column5: Probably Mackenzie mostly, sometimes South Bay and Inlet. Try to avoid traffic!
While fishing near Steamboat Bay we saw this cow moose swimming to shore from another island.https://youtu.be/13TClO5W_ak
Here are the 2 calves we noticed swimming across lake way behind the cow.https://youtu.be/5uVuSoOWm18
There nice to see,your in the right place at the right time.We're the fishing snapping??
Fish were snapping Eck.4 great days.Sunday was a slower day but still good enough.mon-wed was very good.
Lots of doubles and triples.One net.lol.23-25" fish hard to lift in boat with rod..used my fish grabber a lot as net was pretty busy.Lots of pike also as I cleaned 12 25-26"
Nice work John, jigging or trolling? Will be there in a few weeks buddy. Thx!

Jigging.They went somewhat deeper for the most part but had our moments I the 6-8 ft still in the mornings.Main reefs still on slow side.Fished mainly shorelines that had structure coming out.temps ranged 70+f but 2 cool days dropped that temp a bit.Things will change when you get here.which part you fishing

Is the mayfly hatch done? We were up north of Red Lake about a week ago and the first couple days saw a lot of dead mayflies in the bays. Later in the week didn’t see nearly as many. I was surprised considering how warm the water was that we were catching fish in as shallow as 5 foot at times. Using a Carolina rig with floating jig head the fish had to be barely 1-2 foot below the surface when taking the bait. Maybe thought they were up that shallow because they were looking for the mayflies they had been feeding on. But in another spot we caught fish in 25 foot deep so 🤷‍♂️….
Pretty much done but still see bodies here and there.some spots still hold walleyes shallow and weeklies still good to, others are going deeper.
